report_title: Online Baby Product Sales in the US
executive_summary: Online baby product sales retailers have benefited from rising incomes, as increasingly tech-savvy first-time parents can turn to online retailers to create baby registries, furnish nurseries and conveniently order everyday items. COVID-19's sudden shutdown of brick-and-mortar stores accelerated the rise of the digital economy, including online baby product retailers. Consumer behaviors quickly changed following COVID-19, especially for expectant families and first-time parents caring for newborns, who turned to online retailers in greater numbers and frequency. As the effects of COVID-19 faded, the industry returned to more stable growth rates, in line with normal demand. In all, revenue is expected to increase at a CAGR of 11.5% over the past five years and is expected to total $12.8 billion in 2024, when revenue will increase an estimated 2.3%.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Over the past five years, the trend of online shopping has grown exponentially, fueling the growth of the Online Baby Product Sales industry. Convenience, flexibility and a wider range of choices are some of the factors that have propelled the popularity of online shopping. This trend was further accelerated by the COVID-19 outbreak which caused many consumers to shift their shopping habits to online.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Shifting Spending Behaviors by Parents Entices New Entrants
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: A declining birth rate hasn't stunted spending on baby products in recent years. Today's parents are socially and environmentally conscious and reflect that through their purchases. More direct-to-consumer online baby retailers have entered the market to take advantage of these trends. Social media is helping these retailers secure loyal, repeat customers.

As the Online Baby Product Sales industry becomes more competitive, companies have been compelled to innovate, stand out with distinctive offerings and provide superior customer experiences. This trend towards competition-induced innovation is evident in everything from product design, functionality and sustainability to pricing strategies, marketing approaches and customer service capabilities.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Subscription Boxes and Personalized Products Have Supported Growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: There has been a growing trend towards curated subscription boxes for baby products over the past five years. These boxes, often tailored to the age and development stage of the child, offer a range of products from clothes to toys to care items, providing both convenience and novelty for parents.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Parents' Rising Willingness to Spend on Baby Encourages New Entrants
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Subdued revenue growth won't translate to a slowdown in new entrants. A lucrative baby product market will encourage new retailers to enter the market to take advantage of parents willing to spend on more babies than ever, even as the birth rate continues to drop.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Older parents will be a growing market for online retailers
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: A rising median age for parents will benefit retailers, since earning power increases as adults advance in their careers. Retailers like Target and Amazon will keep their stronghold on the online baby product market.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Sustainability Trends Will Force Online Retailers To Adapt
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Over the next five years, sustainability will become a critical trend impacting online baby product retailers because of growing environmental awareness among consumers.

industry_definition: This industry retails infant and toddler products on the internet. Industry products include diapers, clothing, shoes, feeding aids, strollers and furniture. Industry retailers purchase products for resale to consumers with no further development of the product.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: low - increasing

key_trends: Today's parents support small, trendy baby brands.
Leading retailers offer unmatched convenience and cost savings.
The popularity of e-commerce has skyrocketed over the past five years.
A lucrative baby products market is enticing more online retailers to enter.
Amazon is a baby product powerhouse.
Smaller online baby product retailers round out the industry.

market_segmentation.segment_description: This market segment includes consumers between 18 to 30 years old.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Baby Gear (Play Pens, Strollers, Carriers, Toys, Monitors)
products_and_services.product_description: Baby gear includes items like play pens, strollers, carriers, toys, and baby monitors.
This category includes baby diapers and other hygiene supplies.
Baby clothing includes items like onesies.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Per capita disposable income influences how much consumers will spend on baby products.

business_locations.location_description: The West region of the US has a significant number of online baby product retailers because of its strong tech ecosystem.
The Southeast region of the US has a large number of online baby product retailers because of its rapidly growing population.
The Mid-Atlantic region of the US attracts a large number of online baby product retailers because of its dense population.
